meanings.definition: To surpass in willpower or determination.
meanings.sent1: She outwilled her fear and climbed to the top of the tree.
meanings.sent2: He outwilled his laziness and completed the marathon.
meanings.sent3: The little ant outwilled the big grasshopper in carrying the food.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outwilled any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The hero's willpower outwilled the villain's evil plans.

meanings.definition: To be more determined or strong-willed than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The student outwilled his classmates to win the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: She outwilled her siblings to get the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent3: The determined squirrel outwilled the other animals to find the hidden nuts.
meanings.sent4: His strong will outwilled any doubts that came his way.
meanings.sent5: The leader's determination outwilled any opposition in the group.
